ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about different ethical dilemmas that are commonly encountered in science/academia. I learned how to approach some of them, and how to spot others.
I thought the patent law lecture was the most interesting, as was the animal usage history lesson.
I do feel like I thought about some new situations and how I might deal with them.
ethnical question in science in general. A lot of case study where situation gets tough.
I'm learning how to be a fair and nice researcher.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Good, and necessary. Maybe a different time of day would be best. Though I did like the snacks.
Since it's mandatory, I'm not sure how to make it better. Susan was super kind to us by providing cookies.

The professors that cared did a great job. I liked how Chuck and his partner went over some real gray areas in conflict of interest. Other people cared less. I felt like the section on how to deal with conflict with your advisor and switching labs could have been done better. Joan did a great job with some of the plagiarism issues. Nikil obviously cared a lot about his section and put a ton of work into it. It was a great example. But since it was from physics and their experiments/collaboration work differently, I think we spent more time asking about the details of the experiment than talking about the fabrication. The story of using acid to make skin cells pluripotent would be a great example though. The one on IP was fascinating.
I thought some of the sessions may not be as well organized as others.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Well, I think they have to take it anyways. But it was good to learn about and discuss different problems we might face (plagiarism, scientific writing, falsifying data, etc)
Yes. I think the ethic code is slightly different from my original idea, therefore, I think it's important to know some basic idea. Especially what is a proper reaction to the cases in the materials.
